thread.title: There&#039s a lot that goes into when Masahiro Tanaka will start out subsequent
thread.title_full: There&#039s a lot that goes into when Masahiro Tanaka will start out subsequent | Breaking News & Headlines

author: Graham Finley
title: There&#039s a lot that goes into when Masahiro Tanaka will start out subsequent
text:
Joe Girardi said he is waiting to talk to Masahiro Tanaka prior to committing to pitching his ace Wednesday against the Blue Jays in Toronto.
When the Yankees manager began Tanaka on Friday night against the Mets in the initial of three Subway Series games at Citi Field, it was the second straight game Tanaka worked with 4 days’ rest alternatively of the 5 the Yankees have attempted to give him throughout the season.
The technique, which Girardi by no means made public but admitted Saturday, “was the original program,” setting up the Yankees’ finest pitcher to face the Blue Jays on Wednesday on four days’ rest. Nevertheless, the Yankees are 3 ½ lengths behind the AL East leaders right after Saturday’s win. And by Wednesday, that deficit could swell to the point exactly where the Yankees’ concentrate shifts from attempting to be divisional champs to setting up Tanaka to start off the Oct. 6 AL wild card game.
“I assume it is a tiny bit early to ask,” Girardi said Saturday morning about speaking to Tanaka about how he felt significantly less than 24 hours soon after going six innings and throwing 82 pitches in a five-1 loss Friday night — when he gave up two homers. “We will see how he feels [Sunday] when he can possibly play some catch.’’
Girardi mentioned Tanaka’s physical scenario overrides the Yankees’ proximity to the Blue Jays come Wednesday.
“I am speaking about how he feels much more than something else,’’ mentioned Girardi, who has Adam Warren, Luis Severino and Tanaka lined up to face the Blue Jays at Rogers Centre. “I am not talking about the standings, I am speaking a lot more about how he feels. There are issues to talk about but not anything I am ready to talk about nowadays.’’
